sections.title: Introduction
sections.content:
Note: **This article or section does not follow the Laptop page guidelines.** This article or section does not follow the Laptop page guidelines.

This article or section does not follow the Laptop page guidelines.

Table content:
Hardware | PCI/USB ID | Working?
GPU (Intel) | 8086:1616 | Yes
GPU (NVIDIA) | 10de:1346 | Yes
Audio | 8086:160c | Yes
Ethernet | 10ec:8168 | Untested
Wireless | 168c:0036 | Yes
Bluetooth | 168c:0036 | Untested
Webcam | 04f2:b483 | Yes

The laptop's model is X455LF-WX031DC

sections.title: Function keys
sections.content:
```
⎡ Virtual core pointer                    	id=2	[master pointer  (3)]
⎜   ↳ Virtual core XTEST pointer              	id=4	[slave  pointer  (2)]
⎜   ↳ ETPS/2 Elantech Touchpad                	id=14	[slave  pointer  (2)]
⎣ Virtual core keyboard                   	id=3	[master keyboard (2)]
    ↳ Virtual core XTEST keyboard             	id=5	[slave  keyboard (3)]
    ↳ Power Button                            	id=6	[slave  keyboard (3)]
    ↳ Video Bus                               	id=7	[slave  keyboard (3)]
    ↳ Video Bus                               	id=8	[slave  keyboard (3)]
    ↳ Sleep Button                            	id=9	[slave  keyboard (3)]
    ↳ Asus WMI hotkeys                        	id=12	[slave  keyboard (3)]
    ↳ AT Translated Set 2 keyboard            	id=13	[slave  keyboard (3)]
```

No touchscreen.

Fn+Brightness combination does not work. Fn+Volume and media control buttons do work. Fn+ScreenOn/ScreenOff works. Fn+AirplaneMode does not work.

On hibernation touchpad becomes unresponsive. Some users report boot some parameters fix it.

sections.title: Graphics
sections.content: One can use the binary driver's PRIME function to use either NVIDIA (High drain, high performance, no hardware video acceleration (h264) meaning vdpau is not accessible? [1] ) or Intel (low drain, hardware video acceleration (h264)).

sections.title: Firmware
sections.content:
User can disable Secure Boot, AES-NI and Intel Virtualization but cannot disable Intel HyperThreating.

There is a choice of compatibility mode, user reports the option potentially becoming grayed out(?).
